t: For the choir director: with stringed instruments, according to Sheminith. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn do not rebuke me in your anger; do*ln not discipline me in your wrath.
Be*ln gracious to me, Lord,*s for I am weak; heal*ln me, Lord,*s for my bones are shaking;
my*ln whole being is shaken with terror. And*ln you, Lord-*s how long?
Turn,*pn Lord!*s Rescue me; save*ln me because of your faithful love.
For*ln there is no remembrance of you in death; who*ln can thank you in Sheol?
I*pn am weary from my groaning; with*ln my tears I dampen my bed and*ln drench my couch every night.
My*ln eyes are swollen from grief; they*ln grow old because of all my enemies.
Depart*pn from me, all evildoers, for*ln the Lord*s has heard the sound of my weeping.
The*ln Lord*s has heard my plea for help; the*ln Lord*s accepts my prayer.
All*ln my enemies will be ashamed and shake with terror; they*ln will turn back and suddenly be disgraced.
